column1: Art Institute of Chicago////This is a very nice
column3: and incredibly quiet museum. I came for the Degas exhibit and was pleased to see not only paintings
column4: but also sculptures from the artist. There are so many different areas to explore in this museum
column6: so I'm glad I brought flats. I should have done more Ferris Bueller impersonations while viewing some of the most famous artwork in the world. Unfortunately
column7: the 1st floor photography section was closed during our visit - not sure why. If you get there an hour before closing
column9: but that's probably not enough time to enjoy!
